utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She's not here yet. She's not here. She's having my baby and she's not here.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'm sure everything's fine. Has her water broke yet?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don't know, but when I spoke to her, she said she had already passed the mucus plug.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Do we have to know about that?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey, what are you gonna do when you have a baby?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I'm gonna be in the waitin' room, handing out cigars.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, Joey's made arrangements to have his baby in a movie from the 50's.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: God, I don't believe this. She could be giving birth in the cab.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, Ross, relax. It's probably like two dollars for the first contraction, and then fifty cents for each additional contraction.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What, it's ok when Chandler does it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You have to pick your moments.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Did I miss it, did I miss it?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She's not even here yet.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What's with the guitar?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I just thought we might be here for awhile. You know, things might get musical.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Where the hell have you been?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: We stopped at the gift shop.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: I was looking at stuffed animals, and Susan wanted a Chunky.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Susan wanted a Chunky. We're having a baby, ok, a baby, you don't stop for Chunkys.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I used to have that bumper sticker.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You see what I mean.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Stopped for a Chunky.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Let it go, Ross.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: I got an extra one. You want this?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
utterance.content: Hey, how's my favorite parenting team doing?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Dr. Franzblau, hi.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
utterance.content: So, I understand you're thinking of having a baby? Well, I see you're nine months pregnant. That's a good start. How you doing with your contractions?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Oh, I love them. Each one's like a little party in my uterus.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: They're every four minutes and last 55 seconds.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: 59 seconds. Quartz, ha.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Swiss quartz, ha, ha.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Am I allowed to drink anything?

utterance.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
utterance.content: Ice chips, just ice chips. They're at the nurses' station.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'll get it.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: No, I'm getting it. I'll be right back.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I got it—I'm getting it!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi, I thought you might like some ice chips.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And if you need anything else, I——do not believe we've met. Hi. I'm, uh, Rachel Green. I'm Carol's... ex-husband's... sister's roommate.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
utterance.content: It is nice to meet you. I'm Dr. Franzblau. I'm your roommate's... brother's... ex-wife's obstetrician.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, that's funny!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I want a baby.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Mmmm. Not tonight, honey. I got an early day tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Get up. Come on. Let's get some coffee.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, ok, 'cause we never do that.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Shoot! Shoot! Shoot! Shoot, or just fall down. That's good too.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Knick fan?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Oh, boy, do they suck.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, listen, lady.......whoa.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Look, look at your man, Ewing. Nice shot. You know what, he couldn't hit water if he was standing on a boat.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah? And who do you like?

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: The Celtics.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: The Celtics? Ha. They couldn't hit a boat if...wait. They suck, alright?

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Oh, shut up. You know, it's a rebuilding year. You... waah!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wha? Wha..aa? Let me get the father. Hey, we need a father over here! We need a father!

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: There is no father.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, oh, oh, sorry.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Ok, that's ok. I'm fine. I'm... oh!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, uh, ok. Right this way. All the other pregnant women seem to be goin' in here.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thanks, Ross.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah. I'm paying you to stop.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, look, twins. Hi, guys. Oh, cute, cute.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No fair. I don't even have one. How come they get two?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You'll get one.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh yeah? When?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right. I'll tell you what. When we're 40, if neither one of us are married, what do you say you and I get together and have one?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why won't I be married when I'm 40?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, no, no. I just meant hypothetically.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ok, hypothetically, why won't I be married when I'm 40?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, no, no.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What is it? Is there something fundamentally unmarriable about me?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Uh, uh.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Dear God! This parachute is a knapsack!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey. Ooh, look at you, dressy-dress.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Did you go home and change?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, well, it's an important day. I wanna look nice. Um, has uh Dr. Franzblau been by?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, I haven't seen him.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, where is he? He is supposed to be here. What if the baby needs him?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Rachel, what is the deal with you and doctors, anyway? Was, like, your father a doctor?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, why?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No reason.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Mom, we've been through this. No, I'm not calling him. I don't care if it is his kid, the guy's a jerk. No, I'm not alone. Joey's here. What do you mean, Joey who? Joey who?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Tribbiani.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Joey Tribbiani. Yes, ok. Hold on. She wants to talk to you. Take the phone.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hi, yeah, it's me. Oh, no no no, we're just friends. Yeah, I'm single. 25. An actor. Hello?

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: She's not much of a phone person.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, so, uh, so, uh, what's the deal with this father guy, I mean, if someone was havin' my baby somewhere, I'd wanna know about it, you know?

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Hey, Knick fan, am I interested in your views on fatherhood? Uh, no.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ok, look, maybe I should just go.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Maybe you should.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Good luck, and uh, take care, huh?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You know what the Celtics problem is? They let the players run the team.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Oh, that is so not true.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, it is.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: It isn't.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It is.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Isn't!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Breathe.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Breathe.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Breathe.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Breathe.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Breathe.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Breathe.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: You're gonna kill me!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: 15 more seconds, 14, 13, 12...

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Count faster.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: It's gonna be ok, just remember, we're doing this for Jordie. Just keep focusing on Jordie.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Who the hell is Jordie?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Your son.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No-no-no. I don't have a son named Jordie. We all agreed, my son's name is Jamie.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Well, Jamie was the name of Susan's first girlfriend, so we went back to Jordie.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What? Whoa, whoa whoa whoa, what do you mean, back to Jordie? We never landed on Jordie. We just passed by it during the whole Jessy, Cody, Dylan fiasco.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Ow, ow, ow, ow, leg cramp, leg cramp, leg cramp.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I got it.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: I got it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I got it! Hey, you get to sleep with her, I get the cramps.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: No, you don't.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: All right, that's it. I want both of you out.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: He started it!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, you started it.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: You did!

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: I don't care. I am trying to get a person out of my body here, and you're not making it any easier.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: But...

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Now go!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thanks a lot.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: See what you did.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, listen...

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Out!

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Breathe, breathe, breathe...

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Oh, no.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ew! What is that? Something exploded!

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: It's just her water breaking. Calm down, will you?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Water breaking, what do you mean? What's that, water breaking?

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Breathe, breathe, breathe.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Please. This is so your fault.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: How, how is this my fault?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, Carol never threw me out of a room before you came along.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Yeah? Well, there's a lot of things Carol never did before I came along.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You tryin' to be clever? A funny lady?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: You know what your problem is? You're threatened by me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I'm threatened by you?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, hey, ok, all right, that's it! Get in here. Come on. My god, you guys, I don't believe you. There are children coming into the world in this very building and your negative fighting noises are not the first thing they should be hearing. So just stop all the yelling, just stop it!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, Susan.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Don't make me do this again, I don't like my voice like this.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ok, who wants to hear something ironic?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Help!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm having a baby in here! Ok, everyone stand back. Ow.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Are they here yet?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, honey, they're not, but don't worry, because we are going to find them, and until we do, we are all here for you, ok?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ok?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ok, so anyway, you were telling me about Paris, it sounds fascinating.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
utterance.content: It really was. There was this great little pastry shop right by my hotel. There you go, dear.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on, Lydia, you can do it. Push! Push 'em out, push 'em out, harder, harder. Push 'em out, push 'em out, way out! Let's get that ball and really move, hey, hey, ho, ho. Let's— I was just—yeah, right. Push! Push!

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: What're you gonna do, suck the door open?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Help! Help!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: They found their bodies the very next day, they found their bodies the very next... la la la la la la.

utterance.speaker: Susan and Ross
utterance.content: Help!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Now, Mom, everything's going fine, really. Yeah, Ross is great. He's uh, he's in a whole other place. No, he's gone. No no, you don't have to fly back, really. What do you mean this might be your only chance? Would you stop? I'm only 26, I'm not even thinking about babies yet.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Where have you been?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, just had a baby.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Mazel tov!

utterance.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
utterance.content: I don't know, could be an hour, could be three, but relax, she's doing great. So, uh, tell me, are you currently involved with anyone?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, no, not at the moment, no, I'm not. Are you?

utterance.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
utterance.content: No, it's hard enough to get women to go out with me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Right, yeah, I've heard that about cute doctors.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
utterance.content: No, no, really. I suppose it's because I spend so much time, you know, where I do.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
utterance.content: I try not to let my work affect my personal life, but it's hard, when you... do what I do. It's like uh...Well, for instance, what do you do?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I'm a waitress.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
utterance.content: Ok, all right, well aren't there times when you come home at the end of the day, and you're just like, 'if I see one more cup of coffee'...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah. Gotcha.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
utterance.content: I'm gonna go check up on your friend.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ok. That's fine.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: So how did you know I was even here?

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: Your mom called me. So is this her?

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: No, this is a loaner.

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: I'm sorry you had to do this by yourself.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: I wasn't by myself. I had a doctor, a nurse, and a helper guy. So, did you see who won the game?

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: Yeah, the Knicks by 10. They suck.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Yeah, they're not so bad.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on, come on. Damnit, damnit, damnit, damnit. This is all your fault. This is supposed to be, like, the greatest day of my life, y'know? My son is being born, and I should be in there, you know, instead of stuck in a closet with you.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: The woman I love is having a baby today. I've been waiting for this just as much as you have.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No no no, believe me. No one has been waiting for this as much as I have, ok? And you know what the funny thing is? When this day is over, you get to go home with the baby, ok? Where does that leave me?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: You get to be the baby's father. Everyone knows who you are. Who am I? There's Mother's Day, there's Father's Day, there's no... Lesbian Lover Day.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Every day is Lesbian Lover Day.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: This is so great.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You wanna explain that?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I mean, well, 'cause when I was growing up, you know my dad left, and my mother died, and my stepfather went to jail, so I barely had enough pieces of parents to make one whole one. And here's this little baby who has like three whole parents who care about it so much that they're fighting over who gets to love it the most. And it's not even born yet. It's just, it's just the luckiest baby in the whole world. I'm sorry, you were fighting.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Where are they?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'm sure they'll be here soon.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, honey, they wouldn't miss this.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Relax. You're only at nine centimeters. And the baby's at zero station.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You are really frightening me.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Somebody wanna help me, tryin' to rip out my heart. Uh, that's great. Anybody seen a nipple?

utterance.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
utterance.content: All right, ten centimeters, here we go.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: All right, honey, time to start pushing.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: But they're not here yet!

utterance.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
utterance.content: I'm sorry, I can't tell the baby to wait for them.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Oh, god.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ok, got the vent open.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi, I'm Ben. I'm hospital worker Ben. It's Ben... to the rescue!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ben, you ready? All right, gimme your foot. Ok, on three, Ben. One, two, three. Ok, That's it, Ben.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: What do you see?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, Susan, I see what appears to be a dark vent. Wait. Yes, it is in fact a dark vent.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Phoebs, It's open! It's open!

utterance.speaker: Janitor
utterance.content: Wait! You forgot your legs!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Push, push!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We're here!

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Where have you been?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Long story, honey.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
utterance.content: All right, Carol, I need you to keep pushing. I need— Excuse me, could I have this?

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: All right, all right, there's a few too many people in this room, and there's about to be one more, so anybody who's not an ex-husband or a lesbian life partner, out you go!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Good luck!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Let me ask you, do you have to be Carol's lesbian life partner?

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Out!

utterance.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
utterance.content: All right, he's crowning. Here he comes.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Let me see, I gotta see, I gotta see. Oh, a head. Oh, it's, it's huge. Carol, how are you doing this?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Not.... helping!

utterance.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
utterance.content: You're doing great, you're doing fine.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hello! Oh, sorry.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: What do you see? What do you see?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We got a head, we got shoulders, we got arms, we got, oh, look at the little fingers, oh, and a chest, and a stomach. It's a boy, definitely a boy! All right! Ok, legs, knees, and feet. Oh, oh. He's here. He's a person.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Oh, look at that.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: What does he look like?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Kinda like my uncle Ed, covered in Jell-o.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You guys, he's beautiful!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, thanks, Pheebs!

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: No shouting, but we still need a name for this little guy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: How 'bout Ben?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: I like Ben.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Ben. Ben. Ben's good. How come you never mentioned Ben before?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We uh, we just cooked it up.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: That's what we were off doing.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Can we come in?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know, I know. Everybody, there's someone I'd like you to meet. Yeah. This is Ben. Ben, this is everybody.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Susan, he looks just like you.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, god, I can't believe one of us actually has one of these.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I know, I still am one of these.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross, can I?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The head, the head. You gotta...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi, Ben. Hi. I'm your Aunt Monica. Yes I am. I'm your Aunt Monica. I...I will always have gum.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ben, I want you to know that there may be some times when I may not be around, like this. But I'll still always come back, like this. And sometimes I may be away longer, like this. But I'll still always come back, like this.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And sometimes, I'll want you to steal third, and I'll go like this.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: He is so amazing.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I know. Look at him.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ben, Ben, hey Ben. Nothing. I don't think that's his name.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, look, look, he's closing his eyes. Look, he's opening his eyes.

utterance.content: He doesn't do much, does he?

utterance.content: No, this is pretty much it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You guys wanna get some coffee?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right, I'll see you guys later.
